qas.question: The western communists old rhetoric was that the war was?
Where didn't Maurice Thorez go after deserting the Army?
Where did Maurice Thorez go after joining the Army?

context: When anti-German demonstrations erupted in Prague, Czechoslovakia, the Comintern ordered the Czech Communist Party to employ all of its strength to paralyze "chauvinist elements." Moscow soon forced the Communist Parties of France and Great Britain to adopt an anti-war position. On 7 September, Stalin called Georgi Dimitrov,[clarification needed] and the latter sketched a new Comintern line on the war. The new line—which stated <b5_0>that <a0_0><a1_0><b4_0>the war was unjust and imperialist<b5_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>—was approved by the secretariat of the Communist International on 9 September. Thus, the various western Communist parties now had to oppose the war, and to vote against <b6_0>war credits<b6_0/>. Although the French Communists had unanimously voted in Parliament for <a2_0>war credits<a2_0/> on 2 September and on 19 September declared their "unshakeable will" to defend the country, on 27 September the Comintern formally instructed the party to condemn the war as imperialist. By 1 October the French Communists advocated listening to German peace proposals, and Communist leader Maurice Thorez deserted from the French Army on 4 October and <a3_0><b7_0>fled to <b8_0>Russia<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>. Other Communists also deserted from the army.
